ground_truth: She turns toward him and undoes her hair, which falls around her shoulders. Fergus runs his hand down her throat, and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed, pulling him down as they kiss passionately. She then walks into the bathroom, and Fergus lies there, looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water. She comes out dressed in a silk kimono, looking extraordinarily beautiful, and he draws her toward him, beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders, then stop. The kimono falls to the floor gently, with a whisper, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that she is a man. Fergus sits there, frozen, staring at her, saying nothing. She gives a strange little laugh and reaches out to touch him, but he smacks her hand away, gets up, and runs to the bathroom. She grabs his feet, but he kicks her away, runs into the bathroom, and vomits into the tub. She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door shut. She sits on the couch, the kimono round her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her mouth. Fergus comes out of the bathroom, and she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. She grabs him to stop him, but he pulls away, and she falls to the floor. Fergus sits as Col turns to him, and he touches her arm, but she whips her arm away and walks into the crowd, toward the door. Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place, where the blinds in her room are down, and the light is on inside. We see her outline, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette. A man removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine. Below the scoreboard, we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working. Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall, and on the pitch, we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window. Across the pitch, Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As she approaches the site, a chorus of whistles breaks out. Fergus, hearing the whistling, stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site. He drops the window, and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue, we see Dil in the site's lift, which rises up. Meanwhile, we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus, and through this conversation, Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: She turns toward him and unfastens her hair, which cascades around her shoulders. Fergus runs his hand down her neck, and she draws him behind a veil toward the bed, pulling him down as they kiss fervently. She then walks into the lavatory, and Fergus lies there, gazing at the image and listening to the sound of running water. She comes out dressed in a silk robe, looking exceptionally gorgeous, and he draws her toward him, beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the garment down from her shoulders, then stop. The robe falls to the floor gently, with a rustle, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that she is a man. Fergus sits there, motionless, staring at her, saying nothing. She gives a peculiar little laugh and reaches out to touch him, but he slaps her hand away, gets up, and runs to the lavatory. She grabs his feet, but he kicks her away, runs into the lavatory, and retches into the tub. She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door shut. She sits on the sofa, the robe around her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her lips. Fergus comes out of the lavatory, and she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. She grabs him to stop him, but he pulls away, and she falls to the floor. Fergus sits as Col turns to him, and he touches her arm, but she jerks her arm away and walks into the throng, toward the door. Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place, where the shades in her room are down, and the light is on inside. We see her outline, pacing up and down behind the shades, smoking a cigarette. A man removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine. Below the scoreboard, we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the structure where Fergus is working. Fergus is fitting a new window into the completed wall, and on the field, we see cricketers distorted through the shifting glass of the window. Across the field, Dil walks with a meal basket in her hand, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As she approaches the site, a chorus of whistles erupts. Fergus, hearing the whistling, gazes out and sees Dil moving toward the site. He drops the window, and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue, we see Dil in the site's elevator, which ascends. Meanwhile, we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus, and through this dialogue, Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles intensifying.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Toward him, she is turned and her hair is undone, causing it to fall around her shoulders. Down her throat, a hand is run by Fergus, and behind a curtain toward the bed, he is drawn by her, as he is pulled down and they kiss passionately. Into the bathroom, she then walks, and there lies Fergus, looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water. Dressed in a silk kimono, she comes out and is looked at by him as extraordinarily beautiful, and toward him, she is drawn as her face and neck begin to be kissed by him. She murmurs no as the wrap is slipped down from her shoulders by his hands, then they stop. To the floor, the kimono falls gently, with a whisper, and with it, the camera travels, revealing in a close-up that a man is she. There sits Fergus, frozen, as at her he stares, saying nothing. A strange little laugh is given by her and she reaches out to touch him, but her hand is smacked away by him, and to the bathroom, he runs. His feet are grabbed by her, but she is kicked away by him, and into the bathroom, he runs, vomiting into the tub. A cigarette is lit by her as the door is slammed shut by Fergus. On the couch, she sits, with the kimono round her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her mouth. From the bathroom comes Fergus, and to her, she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. To stop him, she grabs him, but away he pulls, and to the floor, she falls. Fergus sits as Col is turned to by her, and her arm is touched by him, but away she whips her arm and into the crowd, toward the door, she walks. Outside Dil's place, Fergus leaves and walks, where in her room, the blinds are down, and inside the light is on. Her outline is seen by us, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette. A large number six is removed from a huge scoreboard with a pole by a man and with a number nine, it is replaced. Below the scoreboard, Dil is seen by us walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working. A new window is being fitted by Fergus into the finished wall, and on the pitch, through the moving glass of the window, cricketers are seen distorted by us. Across the pitch, with a lunch basket in her hand, walks Dil, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As the site is approached by her, a chorus of whistles breaks out. Hearing the whistling, Fergus stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site. The window is dropped by him, and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue, in the site's lift, Dil is seen by us, which rises up. Meanwhile, Deveroux and Franknum are seen climbing up a ladder toward Fergus, and through this conversation, the chorus of wolf whistles increasing is heard by Fergus.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: She turns to him, undoes her hair, and pulls Fergus behind a curtain toward the bed as they kiss passionately. She enters the bathroom, while Fergus lies looking at a picture and listening to running water. She emerges in a silk kimono, appearing stunning, and he begins kissing her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip her wrap, revealing she is a man. Fergus freezes, staring silently. She laughs strangely, reaching out, but he smacks her hand, rushes to the bathroom, and vomits. She lights a cigarette as Fergus slams the door. She sits on the couch, kimono wrapped, resembling a woman, with blood on her mouth. Fergus emerges; she looks hopeful, but he leaves. She grabs him, falls, and he sits while she walks to the door, leaving him. Fergus exits, seeing Dil's silhouette pacing and smoking behind blinds. A man changes a scoreboard number from six to nine. Dil walks toward Fergus’s worksite with a lunch basket, in a short skirt and high heels, drawing whistles. Fergus, hearing them, sees her approach, drops a window, and it shatters. Dil rides up in a lift as Deveroux and Franknum climb a ladder to Fergus, amidst growing wolf whistles.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: She undoes her hair, and Fergus touches her throat. She leads him to the bed, and they kiss. She goes to the bathroom, and Fergus looks at a picture, listening to running water. She returns in a silk kimono, and he kisses her. She murmurs no as her kimono falls, revealing she is a man. Fergus freezes, then rejects her touch, runs to the bathroom, and vomits. She lights a cigarette as the door slams. Sitting on the couch, she resembles a woman with blood on her mouth. Fergus exits the bathroom, but she falls trying to stop him. Fergus leaves, touching her arm before she walks into the crowd. Outside Dil's place, Fergus sees her outline behind blinds. A man changes a scoreboard from six to nine. Dil walks across a lawn toward Fergus, carrying a lunch basket and wearing a short skirt. As she nears, whistles erupt. Fergus drops a window, shattering it, as Dil enters the lift. Deveroux and Franknum climb a ladder to Fergus, who hears increasing whistles.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: With a graceful turn, she faces him, her fingers working deftly to release her hair, letting it cascade down around her shoulders in a silken wave. Fergus, with a gentle touch, trails his hand down the curve of her throat, and she, in response, guides him with an eager hand behind a softly draped curtain leading toward the bed. There, she draws him down alongside her, their lips meeting in a passionate and fervent kiss. After a moment, she rises and makes her way into the bathroom, leaving Fergus lying there, contemplating the picture as he listens to the soothing sound of running water. Shortly after, she reappears, now adorned in a luxurious silk kimono, looking exceptionally beautiful. Fergus feels a magnetic pull towards her and begins to plant tender kisses on her face and neck. Softly murmuring her objections, she gently whispers no as his hands slide the wrap from her shoulders, only to pause. The kimono slips off and gently drapes onto the floor with a soft, whisper-like sound, and at this moment, the camera follows its descent, focusing closely to reveal the unexpected truth—that she is, in fact, a man. Stunned into silence, Fergus remains seated, immobilized, his gaze fixed on her in disbelief, unable to utter a single word. She lets out a peculiar, almost nervous laugh and reaches out with a tentative hand to touch him, but he reacts sharply, slapping her hand away, before bolting upright and rushing to the bathroom. She grabs at his feet in a desperate attempt to hold him, but he kicks her away, making a frantic dash into the bathroom, where he succumbs to his emotions and vomits into the tub. As the door slams shut with finality, she lights a cigarette, sitting on the couch clad in her kimono once more, presenting a striking image of femininity despite the faint trace of blood that tinges her lips. When Fergus eventually emerges from the bathroom, she looks up from her spot on the couch, her face betraying a glimmer of hope as he makes to leave. Attempting to prevent his departure, she grabs at him in a plea, but he wrenches free, causing her to tumble to the ground. Fergus sits down as Col turns to him, but when he reaches to touch her arm, she swiftly pulls it away and, without another word, strides into the gathering crowd, making her way toward the door. Fergus exits as well, stepping outside the confines of Dil's place, where the blinds in her room remain drawn, yet a light burns brightly inside. From the street, we catch a glimpse of her silhouette as she paces back and forth behind the blinds, cigarette smoke curling in the air. Nearby, a man is seen removing a large number six from an enormous scoreboard with a long pole, replacing it with a number nine. Below this scene, Dil is visible strolling across a green lawn, heading towards the building where Fergus is engaged in his work. Busy with the task of fitting a new window into the freshly completed wall, Fergus glances out over the pitch, where cricketers appear distorted through the shifting reflections on the moving glass of the window. In the distance, Dil approaches, carrying a lunch basket and dressed strikingly in a very short skirt complemented by high heels. As she draws nearer to the construction site, a chorus of whistles erupts from those around. Hearing the commotion of whistles, Fergus looks out in surprise and sees Dil making her way toward the site. In his distraction, the window slips from his grasp, and the glass shatters onto the ground. The chorus of whistles grows louder, and we see Dil stepping into the site's lift, which begins to ascend. Meanwhile, Deveroux and Franknum are seen climbing a ladder towards Fergus, and amidst their conversation, the persistent chorus of wolf whistles fills the air, growing ever more resonant.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: With a graceful and fluid turn, she faces him directly, her fingers skillfully working to release her hair from its confines, allowing it to cascade down around her shoulders in a silken, flowing wave. Fergus, with an exceedingly gentle and tender touch, trails his hand down the elegant curve of her throat, and she, responding with eagerness, guides him with a willing hand behind a softly draped curtain that leads them toward the inviting bed. It is there that she draws him down alongside her, and their lips meet in a passionate and fervent kiss that seems to speak volumes. After a fleeting moment, she rises and makes her way into the bathroom, leaving Fergus lying there, absorbed in contemplation, as he listens to the soothing sound of running water coming from the other room. Shortly thereafter, she reappears, now adorned in a luxurious silk kimono, looking exceptionally beautiful and captivating. Fergus feels an irresistible, magnetic pull towards her and begins to plant tender kisses on her face and neck. Softly murmuring her objections, she gently whispers no as his hands slide the wrap from her shoulders, only to pause momentarily. The kimono slips off and gracefully drapes onto the floor with a soft, whisper-like sound, and at that moment, the camera follows its descent, focusing closely to reveal the unexpected and shocking truth—that she is, in fact, a man. Stunned into complete silence, Fergus remains seated, immobilized, his gaze fixed on her in utter disbelief, unable to muster a single word. She lets out a peculiar, almost nervous laugh and reaches out with a tentative hand to touch him, but he reacts sharply, slapping her hand away, before bolting upright and making a rushed dash to the bathroom. She grabs at his feet in a desperate attempt to hold onto him, but he kicks her away, making a frantic escape into the bathroom, where he succumbs to his overwhelming emotions and vomits into the tub. As the door slams shut with a sense of finality, she lights a cigarette, sitting on the couch clad in her kimono once more, presenting a striking image of femininity despite the faint trace of blood that tinges her lips. When Fergus eventually emerges from the bathroom, she looks up from her spot on the couch, her face betraying a glimmer of hope as he makes to leave. Attempting to prevent his departure, she grabs at him earnestly in a plea, but he wrenches free, causing her to tumble painfully to the ground. Fergus sits down as Col turns to him, but when he reaches to touch her arm, she swiftly pulls it away and, without another word, strides into the gathering crowd, making her way determinedly toward the door. Fergus exits as well, stepping outside the confines of Dil's place, where the blinds in her room remain drawn, yet a warm light burns brightly inside. From the street, we catch glimpses of her silhouette as she paces back and forth behind the blinds, cigarette smoke curling gracefully in the air. Nearby, a man is seen removing a large number six from an enormous scoreboard with a long pole, carefully replacing it with a number nine. Below this scene, Dil is visible, strolling across a vibrant green lawn, heading purposefully towards the building where Fergus is engaged in his work. Busy with the intricate task of fitting a new window into the freshly completed wall, Fergus glances out periodically over the pitch, where cricketers appear distorted through the shifting reflections on the moving glass of the window. In the distance, Dil approaches, carrying a charming lunch basket and dressed strikingly in a very short skirt complemented by high heels. As she draws nearer to the bustling construction site, a chorus of whistles erupts from the surrounding workers. Hearing the commotion of whistles, Fergus looks out in surprise and sees Dil making her way confidently toward the site. In his distraction, the window slips from his grasp, and the glass shatters noisily onto the ground. The chorus of whistles grows even louder, and we see Dil stepping into the site's lift, which begins to ascend slowly. Meanwhile, Deveroux and Franknum are seen climbing a ladder towards Fergus, and amidst their animated conversation, the persistent and resonant chorus of wolf whistles fills the air, growing ever more resonant and pervasive.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: She slowly turns her gaze toward him, reaching up to deftly undo her hair, allowing it to cascade down around her shoulders like a silken waterfall. As Fergus gently runs his hand down the length of her throat, a delicate shiver seems to traverse her skin. She seizes his hand with a subtle urgency, guiding him behind a curtain toward the bed, where the world momentarily disappears as she pulls him down, their lips meeting in a fervent, passionate kiss. After a lingering moment, she stands up and quietly walks into the bathroom. Fergus remains on the bed, his eyes fixated on a picture, his ears attuned to the soft, soothing rhythm of running water. Emerging from the bathroom, she is now dressed in an exquisite silk kimono, her beauty seemingly magnified, and he is irresistibly drawn to her, beginning to place gentle kisses on her face and neck. As his hands tenderly slip the wrap from her shoulders, she softly murmurs, "no," causing him to pause. The kimono descends gracefully to the floor, the fabric whispering against the air, and as the camera follows, it reveals in a poignant close-up that she is, in fact, a man. Fergus sits, immobilized, stunned into silence, his eyes locked onto her in disbelief. She emits a peculiar, almost vulnerable laugh, and reaches out to touch him, but in a moment of raw emotion, he swats her hand away, rising abruptly to flee to the bathroom. Desperately, she tries to hold him back by grabbing his feet, but he shakes her off, rushing into the bathroom and succumbing to his turmoil by retching into the tub. Meanwhile, she lights a cigarette, a thin trail of smoke curling into the air as Fergus slams the door shut behind him. Seated on the couch, she wraps the kimono around herself once more, her appearance undeniably feminine, with a faint trace of blood on her mouth. The bathroom door opens, revealing Fergus, who hesitates, and she glances up at him, a flicker of hope in her eyes, but as he starts to leave, she reaches out to stop him. He pulls away from her grasp, causing her to stumble and fall to the floor. Fergus sits as Col turns toward him, reaching out to tenderly touch her arm, but she pulls away sharply, striding purposefully into the crowd toward the door. Fergus eventually leaves the place, stepping outside and noticing the blinds drawn in Dil's room, with the light illuminating her silhouette as she paces back and forth behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette. In a nearby scene, a man uses a pole to remove a large number six from a massive scoreboard, replacing it with a number nine. Beneath this display, Dil is visible walking across a verdant lawn toward the building where Fergus is engaged in his work. Fergus is in the midst of fitting a new window into a completed wall, and through the undulating glass, cricketers can be seen on the field, their forms distorted by the movement. Across the pitch, Dil approaches with a lunch basket in hand, her outfit a daringly short skirt paired with high heels. As she nears the work site, a chorus of whistles erupts from the onlookers. Hearing the commotion, Fergus looks up to see Dil nearing the site, and in a moment of distraction, he accidentally drops the window, resulting in the glass shattering into pieces. The whistling continues unabated as Dil steps into the site's lift, which begins to ascend. Meanwhile, Deveroux and Franknum are seen climbing a ladder toward Fergus, and amidst their exchange, Fergus can still hear the amplified chorus of wolf whistles echoing around him.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: She turns to Fergus, letting her hair fall around her shoulders as they kiss passionately, moving together behind a curtain toward the bed. Afterward, she dresses in a silk kimono and returns to him, looking stunning. Fergus begins kissing her face and neck, but when her kimono falls, revealing her true identity, he is shocked into silence. As she reaches out to him, Fergus reacts abruptly, rushing to the bathroom and vomiting. She lights a cigarette, appearing womanly despite a trace of blood on her mouth. Fergus emerges from the bathroom, and as she tries to stop him from leaving, he pulls away, causing her to fall. She walks into the crowd, distancing herself, while Fergus eventually exits her place. Outside, he notices her silhouette pacing behind the window blinds, smoking. Later, as a cricket score changes on a scoreboard, Dil approaches the building where Fergus works, drawing attention with her appearance. Her presence causes Fergus to drop a window he is fitting, shattering the glass amidst a chorus of whistles. As Dil ascends in a lift, Fergus is interrupted by Deveroux and Franknum climbing toward him, with the wolf whistles growing louder.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: She turns toward him and undoes her hair, which falls around her shoulders in a cascade reminiscent of classic film star glamour. Fergus, whose touch is gentle despite the intensity of the moment, runs his hand down her throat, and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed, pulling him down as they kiss passionately. She then walks into the bathroom, and Fergus lies there, looking at the picture of her that captures an earlier, carefree moment, listening to the sound of running water that echoes in the small, tiled space. She comes out dressed in a silk kimono, a traditional Japanese garment known for its elegance, looking extraordinarily beautiful, and he draws her toward him, beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders, then stop abruptly. The kimono falls to the floor gently, with a whisper that seems to signify a delicate moment shattered, and the camera travels with it, revealing in a close-up that she is a man, a revelation that challenges Fergus's understanding of identity. Fergus sits there, frozen, staring at her, saying nothing as the weight of this new reality settles in. She gives a strange little laugh, a nervous response that betrays her vulnerability, and reaches out to touch him, but he smacks her hand away, overwhelmed and confused, then gets up and runs to the bathroom. She grabs his feet, desperate to reconnect, but he kicks her away, runs into the bathroom, and vomits into the tub, a visceral reaction to his emotional turmoil. She lights a cigarette, the smoke curling around her as Fergus slams the door shut, a symbolic barrier between them. She sits on the couch, the kimono round her once more, looking very much like a woman, with a trace of blood on her mouth that hints at the recent struggle. Fergus comes out of the bathroom, and she looks up, some hope in her face, as he makes to go. She grabs him to stop him, but he pulls away, and she falls to the floor, her longing unfulfilled. Fergus sits as Col turns to him, and he touches her arm, but she whips her arm away, carrying her wounded pride and walks into the crowd, toward the door, disappearing into anonymity. Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place, a modest apartment in a bustling neighborhood, where the blinds in her room are down, and the light is on inside. We see her outline, pacing up and down behind the blinds, smoking a cigarette, a solitary figure lost in thought. A man, part of a cricket match in full swing, removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine, signaling a change in the game. Below the scoreboard, we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working, a construction site that symbolizes new beginnings. Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall, and on the pitch, we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window, their lively energy contrasting with his internal struggle. Across the pitch, Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand, dressed in a very short skirt with high heels, her appearance causing a stir. As she approaches the site, a chorus of whistles breaks out, a crude acknowledgment from the workers. Fergus, hearing the whistling, stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site, his heart caught between past and present. He drops the window, and the glass shatters, a symbol of his fractured state. As the whistles continue, we see Dil in the site's lift, which rises up, elevating her above the noise and chaos below. Meanwhile, we see Deveroux and Franknum, colleagues well-known for their gossiping nature, climbing up a ladder toward Fergus, and through this conversation, Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing, a soundtrack to his confusion and unresolved emotions.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Meanwhile we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus and through this conversation Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing.

On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. She grabs him to stop him but he pulls away and she falls to the floor. Fergus sits as Col turns to him and he touches her arm but she whips her arm away and walks into the crowd toward the door. Fergus leaves and walks outside Dil's place where the blinds in her room are down and the light is on inside. We see her outline pacing up and down behind the blinds smoking a cigarette. A man removes a large number six from a huge scoreboard with a pole and replaces it with a number nine. Below the scoreboard we see Dil walking across a lawn toward the building where Fergus is working. Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall and on the pitch we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window. Across the pitch Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As she approaches the site a chorus of whistles breaks out. Fergus hearing the whistling stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site. He drops the window and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue we see Dil in the site's lift which rises up. Meanwhile we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus and through this conversation Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: She turns toward him and undoes her hair which falls around her shoulders. Fergus runs his hand down her throat and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed pulling him down as they kiss passionately. She then walks into the bathroom and Fergus lies there looking at the picture and listening to the sound of running water. She comes out dressed in a silk kimono looking extraordinarily beautiful and he draws her toward him beginning to kiss her face and neck. She murmurs no as his hands slip the wrap down from her shoulders then stop. The kimono falls to the floor gently with a whisper and the camera travels with it revealing in a closeup that she is a man. Fergus is fitting a new window into the finished wall and on the pitch we see cricketers distorted through the moving glass of the window. Across the pitch Dil walks with a lunch basket in her hand dressed in a very short skirt with high heels. As she approaches the site a chorus of whistles breaks out. Fergus hearing the whistling stares out and sees Dil moving toward the site. He drops the window and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue we see Dil in the site's lift which rises up. Meanwhile we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus and through this conversation Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing.

test_cases.description: She turns toward him and undoes her hair which falls around her shoulders. Fergus runs his hand down her throat and she draws him behind a curtain toward the bed pulling him down as they kiss passionately. He drops the window and the glass shatters. As the whistles continue we see Dil in the site's lift which rises up. Meanwhile we see Deveroux and Franknum climbing up a ladder toward Fergus and through this conversation Fergus can hear the chorus of wolf whistles increasing.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: She spins away from the parrot and ties her shoelaces, which dangle near her elbows. Lionel brushes his elbow against her ankle, and she drags him over a rug toward the sofa, pushing him up as they laugh loudly. She then hops into the sundae bar, and Lionel stands there, gazing at the painting and humming to the tune of distant music. She steps out wrapped in a wool jacket, appearing exceptionally goofy, and he pulls her toward him, starting to pat her forehead and knees. She mutters yes as his elbows tug the jacket from her elbows, then freeze. The jacket glides to the carpet silently, with a murmur, and the telescope glides with it, revealing in a song that she is a rabbit. Lionel stands there, stunned, glaring at her, whispering everything. She releases a peculiar small sneeze and reaches out to punch him, but he bites her wrist away, stands up, and crawls to the lounge. She bites his ankles, but he nudges her away, sprints into the lounge, and dances into the dishwasher. She ignites a flashlight as Lionel closes the window loudly. She rests on the recliner, the jacket around her once again, appearing very much like a penguin, with a speck of mud on her cheek. Lionel strolls out of the lounge, and she glances down, some rain in her fingertips, as he jumps to laugh. She whispers to him to release him, but he kicks away, and she floats to the ground. Lionel dances as Cory rolls to her, and he pushes her nose, but she fans her hair away and sprints into the party, toward the piano. Lionel departs and dances beneath Sam's tower, where the curtains of her theater are up, and the fan is off outside. We glimpse her silhouette, sleeping up and down behind the curtains, eating a cookie. A mouse attaches a tiny letter two to a small billboard with a string and leaves it with a letter three. Behind the billboard, we notice Sam running across a meadow toward the library where Lionel is eating. Lionel is closing a tiny door into the broken roof, and on the garden, we see lions distorted through the shifting curtain of the door. Alongside the garden, Sam dances with an umbrella in her mouth, dangling in a really tall hat with low boots. As she escapes the tunnel, a melody of claps bursts out. Lionel, hearing the clapping, peers in and catches Sam skipping toward the tunnel. He removes the curtain, and the wall crumbles. As the claps increase, we notice Sam in the tunnel's hammock, which lowers down. Meanwhile, we glimpse Dunkley and West climbing down a staircase from Lionel, and through this whisper, Lionel can see the melody of bird songs decreasing.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: She turns to him, letting her hair fall as they kiss passionately before heading to the bathroom. Emerging in a silk kimono, she looks stunning. As they embrace, the kimono drops, revealing she is a man, shocking Fergus into silence. He rejects her touch and retreats to the bathroom to vomit. She lights a cigarette, looking feminine, with blood on her mouth. Fergus exits, and despite her hopeful look, he leaves as she falls to the floor trying to stop him. Fergus walks outside her place, seeing her silhouette pacing inside. Later, Dil walks toward Fergus's worksite, drawing whistles from the workers. Distracted, Fergus drops a window, shattering it. Dil rides the lift up as whistles grow, with Fergus's colleagues approaching him.
